text: Hey Devs,  I need assistance integrating HubSpot with a third-party CRM with the private app, how is the process, I had already created a private app and the other CRM has provided the API,  but I don't know how to start or from where, any idea could help, thanks for advance
I had read the HubSpot developer documentation but i couldn't find any idea <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-1>
Is there a way to use a HubSpot Landing page as a log in page for a product? (Instead of adding HubSpot  Private app api to the product)

Hey, I'm interested in using the Conversations API (currently in beta) for developing an in-app chat app connected to client issues (HubSpot tickets).
The documentation offers the Chat widget as the solution for the real time conversation but i have doubts if it is possible to work with long term conversations in it (so it shows the message history).

Does any of you knows the best way to approach this issue?
Thanks in advance

You can definitely use the chat widget but, yeah it's probably not going to be the best experience. I personally setup a serverless function which would communicate with the frontend of the application. The serverless function was just for interacting with the conversations api.
There aren't any specific syncing apis, if you want to build a contacts sync you'll use the contacts api, if you want to build a company sync, you'll use the companies api, etc.

Well, here is the end result: <https://www.linkedin.com/posts/teun-rutten-500a2b90_HubSpotdevelopertipsandtricks-HubSpottipsandtricks-activity-6995404590204514304-IfuQ?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop|https://www.linkedin.com/posts/teun-rutten-500a2b90_HubSpotdevelopertipsandtricks-hub[…]590204514304-IfuQ?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop>

We’re trying to push data from Raiser’s Edge NEXT but it has been proven difficult. The client doesn’t have Ops Hub Pro. So, I’m wondering if  if we can use a HubSpot workflow to replace an existing property value that is already existent in HubSpot? For example, find the [First Name] and check if the value “Dario” is true, then replace the value with “Gato”. I don’t think it’s possible with the default actions but maybe with custom code or a webhook?

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

I have been looking through the API v3 endpoint documentation for a way to get all deals with the property "Email Reports" (by using its internal name and internal value), but no luck so far. This property has a dropdown select field type that can be set to enabled (value 1) or disabled (value 0), and the idea is to return all deals with "Email Reports" enabled so that I can programmatically export the results on a regular basis using Python/C#.  Is there a simple way to accomplish this?

Hi, I'm having an issue with the API and wanted to see if I could get any help here. I created a marketing event and am trying to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events|record endpoint> to register one of my contacts to that event. While the response I get says it completed the process, it's never reflected on HubSpot's UI. Any idea why this could be happening?

I have an application which requires webhooks to pull data back into it when changes occur on HubSpot. We want to support custom properties our customers create, and allow them to specify which properties they want to use, but the app control panel requires creating a subscription for each property. Is there a way to have a propertyChanged wildcard or something? Or how would this normally be accomplished?
You could use lastmodified date, it will watch for all property changes
but how do I register a webhook subscription on that?
but then I have to actually query for the property’s value, no? and maintain the current value?
Yes you would then have to query for the property value
I’m working on a CRM Extension Card with a `Action Hook` – but I’m not getting the `X-HubSpot-Signature` header on the action. Any thoughts?
My mistake! I have it set to an IFrame. Is there any way to get iframes signed with HubSpot details? or do I have to roll my own nonce-ish solution?
